intro: Cyclanthera tamnoides, commonly known as the African bitter melon, is a climbing vine native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes other gourd and melon species. The plant produces small, green, egg-shaped fruits that are typically harvested when immature. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often used in traditional medicine. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters.
